info.name: Employee Attendance & Leave Management API
info.description:
Complete API collection for Employee Attendance and Leave Management System

**Base URL:** http://69.62.77.6:9999

**Note:** All protected routes require JWT token in Authorization header.

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Import this collection into Postman
2. Set the `baseUrl` variable to your server URL (default: http://69.62.77.6:9999)
3. Use the Signup or Login endpoint to get a token
4. The token will be automatically saved to the `authToken` variable
5. All protected routes will use this token automatically

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
Register a new employee account.

**Request Body:**
- `name` (required): Employee full name
- `email` (required): Unique email address
- `password` (required): Password (will be hashed)
- `employeeId` (required): Unique employee ID

**Response:**
- Returns user details and JWT token on success
- Token is automatically saved to collection variable

request.description:
Record daily check-out time for the authenticated user.

**Authentication:** Required (JWT token)

**Requirements:**
- User must have checked in earlier on the same day

**Response:**

- Prevents duplicate check-outs for the same day

request.description:
Get attendance records for a specific date range.

**Authentication:** Required (JWT token)

**Query Parameters:**
- `from` (required): Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format
- `to` (required): End date in YYYY-MM-DD format

**Response:**
- Returns array of attendance records with check-in/check-out times
- Records are sorted by date in ascending order

item.name: Leave

exec: // Auto-set authorization header from collection variable

request.description:
Submit a leave application.

**Authentication:** Required (JWT token)

**Request Body:**
- `fromDate` (required): Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format
- `toDate` (required): End date in YYYY-MM-DD format
- `reason` (required): Reason for leave
- `type` (required): Leave type - one of: `sick`, `casual`, `other`

**Validation:**
- Date range must be valid (fromDate <= toDate)
- No overlapping leaves with existing approved/pending leaves

**Response:**
- Returns leave application details
- Status will be 'pending' initially
- Leave will be processed by cron job within 1 minute

exec: // Auto-set authorization header from collection variable

request.description:
Get all leave applications for the authenticated user.

**Authentication:** Required (JWT token)

**Response:**
- Returns array of all leave applications
- Sorted by applied date in descending order (newest first)
- Includes leave status: `pending`, `approved`, or `rejected`
